title: Exiting multiple loops
question: Which of these statements about multiple loops are true?
hint: Exiting multiple loops is done by using break with a loop label.

correct.answer: A loop inside a loop is called a nested loop.
Using break by itself exits the current loop only.
You can exit more than one loop at a time.
You can break out of a labeled loop whenever you need.
You can embed one loop inside another.

wrong.answer: You may have only one labeled loop.
Nesting can only be used with for loops.
You can exit up to two loops at a time.
You can only break out of loops inside a condition.
You can write break 3 to break out of two loops.
